job description:
This individual perform fermentation process development activities from benchtop scale to pilot scale using Quality by Design approach (ICH Q8) to support the commercial sodium hyaluronate manufacturing process. They will develop and troubleshoot commercial scale fermentation process; operate bench scale bioreactors to qualify raw materials; serve as technical resource for process development, evaluation and validation projects related to fermentation and downstream processing of sodium hyaluronate manufacturing; perform critical analysis of process data, interpret results, and draw scientific conclusions present data at group meetings and other broader audiences within or outside the company; communicate results through appropriate documentation and batch records; write development reports as required; troubleshoot equipment and procedure failures.

Requirements: BS/BA in microbiology or related life science with 5-8 years of bench and/or pilot scale fermentation process experience. Experience with processes or methods used in the biotechnology industry and FDA regulated industry experience. Highly developed lab skills and techniques; familiarity with bioreactors/fermenters, process controls, and cell enumeration techniques.
